qas.question: What is first copied into RNA as an intermediate in the manufacture of the final protein product?
In some cases, what are the actual functional products?
What sort of synthesis occurs when the RNA molecules are the actual functional products?

answers.text: the synthesis of ribosomal RNA and transfer RNA

qas.question: What sort of function are ribozymes capable of?
What are the DNA sequences from which ribozymes are transcribed known as?

context: <a0_0>A typical protein-coding gene<a0_0/> is first copied into RNA as an intermediate in the manufacture of the final protein product.:6.1 In other cases, <a1_0>the RNA molecules<a1_0/> are the actual functional products, as in <a2_0>the synthesis of ribosomal RNA and transfer RNA<a2_0/>. Some RNAs known as ribozymes are capable of <a3_0>enzymatic function<a3_0/>, and microRNA has a regulatory role. The DNA sequences from which such RNAs are transcribed are known as <a4_0>non-coding RNA genes<a4_0/>.
